result.execSummary:
The defendant Arwin C Lacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Arwin C Lacy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Arwin C Lacy was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Info filed, copy given defn, reading waived, defn stands mute, Ct enters plea of NG, Motions due 20 days, bail continued.
to Br 11

Defendant Arwin C Lacy in court with attorney Sarah M Schmeiser. Prosecuting Atty Joseph E. Mimier appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Officer J.K. duly sworn and testified.  Direct exam by ADA Mimier.  Witness identified defendant.   Venue established.  Cross-exam by Attorney Schmeiser.   State rests.  No evidence by defense.  Motion by State for bindover and wiaves argument.  Argument by Atty Schmeiser opposing bindover.  Rebuttal by ADA.  Court finds probable cause for reasons outlined and binds case over to Br. 11.
Preliminary hearing at 11-03-2015 10:45 am

Defendant Arwin C Lacy in court with attorney Sarah Schmeiser.   Prosecuting Atty Joseph E. Mimier appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Atty Schmeiser stated she was just retained today to represent defendant.  State moves to commence the hearing and then setover the remainder of the hearing so he can get his last witness here.  No objection by defense.  Testimony taken.  Officer E.V. duly sworn and testified.  DIrect exam by Atty Mimier.   Cross-exam by Atty Schmeiser.  Re-direct exam by ADA Mimier.  Court notes PH commenced today and it will continue on 11/3/15 @ 10:45 a.m.  Bail continued.
Amended, Atty Stanley Woodard
Preliminary hearing at 10-30-2015 02:15 pm
Preliminary hearing at 10-30-2015 02:15 pm

ADA Jay Mimier for State of Wisconsin.  Arwin Lacy in court.  Mr. Lacy does not have an attorney yet.  He indicated on the record the attorneys he did speak with to retain counsel.  Mr. Lacy did go to SPD last Friday to apply, but just signed the paperwork yesterday.  He stated when he went Friday, intake was closed.   SPD told the court they just got the paperwork yesterday.  Mr Lacy provide to court a form from SPD.   The form indicates Mr. Lacy qualifies, but no attorney has been appointed yet.  Atty Lacy states he spoke with an Attorney named Mark who works with Atty Verhoff and he was told he would need to file a bail motion to have the Judge hear the bail.  Court informed Mr. Lacy she is disappointed with him because she has given him opportunities to get an attorney and has not as of yet.  Court also stated SPD had appointed Atty David Knoll, but Mr. Lacy wanted Atty Verhoff.  Record made.   Atty Mimier states the case is set for STC today, so even if the defn had an attorney today, he would not be prepared to go forward today because he doesn't have a witness here today.  Atty Mimier requests court set case for prel hearing.  Court will set Prel hearing for 10/30/15 @ 2:15 p.m.  Court states if he appears at the next hearing without counsel, the court may find he waives right to counsel.  Bail continued.
Status conference at 10-21-2015 01:45 pm

ADA Jay Mimier for State of Wisconsin in court.  Arwin Lacy, defendant in court.  Defendant does not have an attorney.  Defn stated he can't afford the retainer fee that Atty Verhoff requested.  Defn had Atty Knoll previously and the court allowed him to withdraw.  ADA not opposed to the court setting the PH for 20-30 days out to permit defn to go to SPD to see if he can get another attorney or see if he can retain counsel.  Defn wants counsel.  Court will give the defn more time to get counsel.  Court will set STC on 10/21/15 @ 1:45 p.m.   Defn needs to make arrangements to get an attorney by this date.  He can go to SPD to see if he qualifies or retain counsel.  Defn provided map to SPD by ADA.  If defn shows without counsel, the court may be asked by the State to have defn waive counsel.    Court notes time limits have already been waived on this case.  Defn needs to take concrete steps to take care of this.  At some point the court will determine the defn waives counsel and will have to go forward without counsel.  Defn was told to ask for his bail money back so he can apply it towards a retainer fee.   Court stated he needs to talk to a lawyer.
from Atty Verhoff advising that he has not been retained as atty for the defn
Atty David Knoll; Atty has filed a motion to withdraw

Atty Knoll moves to withdraw.  Defn retained Atty Tim Verhoff to represent him on this case.  Time limits not waived yet.  Defn meets with Atty Verhoff tomorrow morning.  Defn waives time limits.  Ct will set STC 10/14/15 @ 1:15 p.m.
Status conference at 10-14-2015 01:15 pm
Preliminary hearing at 10-01-2015 09:00 am
